channel.title: Hs_err_pid errors
channel.description:
dear moparcrafters,
I have tried to install minecraft on my old dell computer (latitude d610). I did try to reInstall java etc. but I still get these java errors. I have no idea how I could fix this so maybe someone can help me?
thanks in advance, halflive9

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“k4den, post:15, topic:446505”]this sort of error also happens with a lot of Runescape clients when you run them using 64x…
is your XP running 32bit or 64bit?

if its 64 bit, then install the 32 bit java and make a batch file to run the minecraft launcher using the 32 bit java instead and see if that helps.[/quote]
I have 32 bit java

Read full topic

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

this sort of error also happens with a lot of Runescape clients when you run them using 64x…
is your XP running 32bit or 64bit?

if its 64 bit, then install the 32 bit java and make a batch file to run the minecraft launcher using the 32 bit java instead and see if that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“triston001, post:13, topic:446505”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=549377.msg4030061#msg4030061 date=1340669737]
do that then go to 88 mph and you will go back to November 5 1955
[/quote]
i dont know what would happen. so im just saying would it might cause a crash or will it do nothing at all?[/quote]

well if there was a wall at the location you hit 88mph on it will cause a crash

Read full topic

if i accidently allocate more memory than i have what would happen?

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Follow these instructions: http://www.microsoft.com/resources/documentation/windows/xp/all/proddocs/en-us/sysdm_advancd_perform_change_vmpagefile.mspx?mfr=true

Or if you cba reading http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zGAtH3ZLSgk

Read full topic

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

i would if i knew how. i made a post about it and soharuda said i needed more memory. i still can’t figure out how to add more. :I

Read full topic

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

triston001:

that looks alot like the ones i get! but it happens when i play on minecraft for awhile.

Probably a memory issue. Try increasing your pagefile.

Read full topic

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

that looks alot like the ones i get! but it happens when i play on minecraft for awhile.

item.title: Hs_err_pid errors
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

I’m guessing your gfx card doesnt support openGL, I have the same thing with my ATI radeon. My fix was to buy a new card.
Since you’re trying to play on a notebook you can forget running minecraft on that.

Read full topic

There should be an error log in the same folder as the minecraft client, gimme that
